question.body: The purified form of botulinum toxin, known commercially as Botox, "paralyzes" muscles locally. What disease can this be used to treat? For these choices, "atrophy" means partial or complete wasting away and "-pathy" means damage or disease.

response.feedback: Correct. Botox was originally developed to relax muscle spasms. Now itâ€™s often used to relax muscles in order to reduce wrinkles.
Incorrect. The toxin is developed from bacteria, but it would have no effect on a bacteria infection.
Incorrect. Botox affects the neuromuscular junction, but it does not cause or repair damage to the nerve.
Incorrect. Eventually a lack of nervous stimulation would cause atrophy, so Botox would not be used to treat atrophy.

Poisoning with botulinum toxin causes muscle paralysis.
